translations.3527901561235537530: To make your application or website available for multiple languages and locale, you need to learn this.
translations.2002272803511843863: {VAR_PLURAL, plural, =0 {just now} =1 {one minute ago} other {{INTERPOLATION} minutes ago}}
translations.6700571274090221926: Go to the root folder of application and run this command
translations.267895817947771775: You can specifiy these 3 option in above command
translations.4605597028568085587: If you want to create extraction of language at particular place in root then specifiy this option.
translations.4285899054553641654: You can change the name of generated file also.
translations.4871360086936067390: After extraction it will create source file of all the static strings in your application where you have added {$START_BOLD_TEXT}`i18n`{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} attribute.
translations.8989606617054234553: Now create copy of files in same folder and give them names according to your languages. If your application supports English, Spanish and Arabic, then your file names will be:
translations.2040254805081608311: Now you need a good translator who can translate the text existing in these source files for you. For each format {$START_BOLD_TEXT}xlf | xlf2 | json | xmb | arb{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} the files will give you different string formats. So understand properly before giving to translator.
translations.3071233987873452035: Registering Locale is required step. Without this {$START_BOLD_TEXT}`number|date|currency`{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} pipes will not make proper formatting. To do that you have to use {$START_BOLD_TEXT}`registerLocaleData`{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} in {$START_BOLD_TEXT}`app.module.ts`{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}
translations.5806796044225488878: For creating all languages build add following code in your application workspace config file.
translations.472173587755727884: To serve for particular language you have to add following code in your application workspace config.
translations.1050851650049820294: Now you can create separate commands in {$START_BOLD_TEXT}`package.json`{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} also. These commands will help you to run specific things directly.
